observation: HCWE Home  Home Products About Contact Archives Sign In Sign Out HCWE Publications HCWE restricted Important Message to Subsribers Regarding Email Delivery Over 3500 HCWE publications are available online. You can view and print lists from this link: Publications List Builder US 978-468-4575 or send us a message Get Help Market-driven tools for asset allocation and strategic investment With many decades in the business of capital-market analysis and reporting, HCWE remains one of the most dependable resources for innovative research designed specifically for the institutional investor. We distribute our research findings in a variety of periodic reports with telephone and video conferences and occasional on-site briefings. R. David Ranson, Highlights from Recent Publications Authorized users can view recent publications by signing in and visiting the Interest-Rate Outlook What drives the Treasury-bond market up or down? - 02/29/2024 Financial capital is constantly flowing back and forth between the markets for Treasury bonds and equities. In each market one of the motivating forces is uncertainty or anxiety about future returns. Implied volatility (VIX and MOVE) quantifies these uncertainties and, when they are high, helps predict performance. Equity-Market Outlook The stock market's secret sauce: super-cheap energy - 02/27/2024 In a world full of old and new geopolitical threats the price of energy fluctuates widely, with effects on inflation and stock-market prices that are not adequately recognized. Strategic Asset Selector Reduced-volatility investments in energy - 03/31/2024 Investments in energy commodities or equities are highly volatile, reflecting the instability of the oil market. But adding OVX can greatly reduce portfolio volatility.
